Mytrah Energy (India) Pvt. Ltd.


Headquartered in London, UK, the Mytrah Group is focused on 
delivering sustainable energy
 in a world without subsidies. Mytrah Energy (India) Pvt. Ltd. aims to own and operate 
3500 MW of Renewable Power
 in India. Currently, it has a total wind portfolio energy capacity of 
1000 MW.
 These assets are spread across 
fifteen wind farms in eight states
 - 
Rajasthan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu.
 The company's portfolio was built using a combination of 'turn-key' developers and in-house project development, with wind turbines purchased from leading international vendors.


For further info, one can visit their website - 
Mytrah Energy (India) Pvt. Ltd
.


Collaboration with Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS), Pilani


Mytrah Energy (India) Pvt. Ltd. has 
signed an MoU
 with BITS Pilani Hyderabad Campus in order to hire college students (as interns) and give them projects which will be useful to the company, such as creating 
Automation Tools and Softwares
. This, in turn, helps the students getting exposed to the 
"corporate world"
. Difficulties faced in real-life problems are brought to light. Apart from that, students learn to 
apply
 their educational knowledge and come up with different approaches to solve a given problem.


Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS), Pilani - Hyderabad


Established in 2008, BITS Pilani Hyderabad Campus is the fourth BITS campus after Pilani, Dubai and Goa. It serves as a home to around 4000 undergraduates, 500 M.Tech students, and 100 Ph.D scholars. Around 5 lakh students write the 
BITSAT
 (Entrance Exam for Engineering) every year, and only 2200 students are selected (across all the campuses). Being the best private institution in the country, BITS Pilani admits students based only on 
pure merit
. 

One can get more information on the 
BITS Pilani
 website.

docs.text:
Why was this project undertaken?


Performing complex calculations on the data collected from a windmill has never been an easy task. Calculating power/energy values, and generating power/efficiency curves demands tremendous amounts of calculations in MS Excel, as well as a huge amount of time. And with time, comes patience. In this fast-paced world, 
time
 wasted is nothing short of 
money
 being wasted. Hence, we, students of BITS Pilani Hyderabad Campus, took up this project and came up with a solution for 
automating the entire process of performing all the necessary calculations as efficiently as possible and creating results/graphs within just a few seconds.
 


Once the application is installed, the user is only required to upload the necessary 
raw data files.
 After that, the results of all the calculations are 
just a few clicks away
!


The merit and accomplishment of this project can be measured only in terms of the amount of 
time saved
 by the user!

docs.text:
Front End


The face of the application is created in 
HTML5
 & 
CSS
, and is integrated with Bootstrap! (making it responsive to device/screen size). [Visit the 
Bootstrap
 page for more info.]


Back End




Languages - 
Java (JSP)
 & 
SQL
.


Database - 
MySQL (Open Source, Relational Database)
. [
Download
]




Compatibilities




This application will require a server which is using 
Apache Tomcat 7.0
 (or above).   [Visit the 
Apache Tomcat
 page for more info.]


Server Machine Operating System - 
Windows ONLY
.


Any version of MySQL can be used along with this application. Using the latest one is highly recommended. Whichever version of MySQL one chooses to install, the user 
must ensure
 that MySQL is using its 
Standard Port (i.e. 3306)
 on the server.

docs.text:
Installation Steps


STEP 1 :
 Click on the 
Mytrah-PCGT-installation.exe
 file which is in the main directory of the application.


STEP 2 :
 It will ask you to enter your server's ROOT directory. After filling it up, click on 
Install
.  This will deploy the application on your server and also import the PCGT database in MySQL.


STEP 3 :
 Start using the application by setting up your '
temp
 ' folder location on the server. Create a new folder which is 
NOT
 in the same directory as the Operating System (to avoid permission issues). This temporary folder is used to store files created during the runtime of this application. After it has been created, open up your internet browser and navigate to the following URL - 
https://localhost/Mytrah/ServerDetails/config.html
 . 
On this page, enter the 
absolute address (path)
 of your temp folder.


STEP 4 :
 After the '
temp
 ' folder has been set up, you're good to go! Just restart the server and enter the following URL for the landing page - 
https://localhost/Mytrah/PCGT/index.html
 .

docs.text:
The Landing Page


The user can upload the 
raw data
 file here.




The Site Details Page


A form to fill in the 
windmill specifications
.




The Filter


By applying suitable filters, the user can 
clean up
 the data, by removing the garbage and unnecessary values. This step is important for getting 
refined results
.




Static Details


Here, the user can upload the 
Static Power
 and the 
Frequency Distribution
 values. 




Binning


Binning gives a clear indication as to what the values of certain parameters are, in a 
specific windspeed range
. The length of this interval (range) can be set to 
1 or 0.5
 (as per the requirement of the user).




Uncertainty


This a form for the user to enter all the uncertainty values relating to the windmill.




Where Magic Happens!


As you can guess, this is where all the results are generated.




Viewing the Database (Real-Time)


This is a solution to solve the problem of entering any garbage data, either while typing or while uploading any file. It is a 
GUI
 (Graphical User Interface) created by us, which shows all the current (real-time) values stored in the database. 
Proves to be of immense help while debugging!








Viewing Graphs


As the name suggests, this page will generate all the graphs based on the values/results stored in the database. Make sure you have completed the 
entire step-by-step procedure
 before this, prior to clicking this button.




Side Menu


This menu comprises of various navigation tools, such as the 
Data Entry Page, Credits Page
 and the 
View Database Page
. The 
PCGT Database
 dropdown serves as a menu to download tables from the database as 
CSV files
. Note the 
Clear Memory
 button. It will erase the entire database. It is to be used only after downloading & verifying results/graphs for a particular windmill OR starting with a new windmill site. 




Back to the top
